abstract: Wells Fargo and other large banks want to become the new housing finance giants and bundle mortgages into securities. But they want an explicit government guarantee.
snippet: Wells Fargo and other large banks want to become the new housing finance giants and bundle mortgages into securities. But they want an explicit government guarantee.
lead_paragraph: As the Obama administration prepares a report on the future of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, some of the nation’s largest banks are offering a few suggestions.

headline.main: Banks Want Pieces of Fannie and Freddie’s Business
headline.print_headline: Banks Want Pieces Of Fannie-Freddie Pie

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal National Mortgage Association Fannie Mae

abstract: Wells Fargo and other large banks want to become the new housing finance giants and bundle mortgages into securities. But they want an explicit government guarantee.
snippet: Wells Fargo and other large banks want to become the new housing finance giants and bundle mortgages into securities. But they want an explicit government guarantee.
lead_paragraph: As the Obama administration prepares a report on the future of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, some of the nation’s largest banks are offering a few suggestions, Louise Story reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Banks Want Pieces of Fannie-Freddie Pie
